review_reason: Mathematical impossibility discovered: maximal_tcs_is_mcs theorem is false. Counterexample found where set is maximal in TemporalConsistentSupersets but not maximal consistent. The proposed henkinStep modification cannot fix this because the issue is fundamental to the theorem statement, not the Henkin construction.

partial_progress.details: Phase 1 blocked: discovered that maximal_tcs_is_mcs theorem is mathematically false. Counterexample: base={neg psi}, henkinLimit adds G(psi) consistently, resulting M is maximal in TCS but M union {F(psi)} is consistent (hence M is not MCS). The conflict arises because G(psi)->F(psi) is a theorem, so neither F(psi)'s package nor neg(F(psi)) can be consistently added, yet F(psi) not in M and insert F(psi) M is consistent.

errors.message: The theorem maximal_tcs_is_mcs claims that a set maximal in TemporalConsistentSupersets is SetMaximalConsistent. This is false. Counterexample: M = {neg(psi), G(psi)} is maximal in TCS (adding F(psi) would require psi for saturation, but neg(psi) is present). However, M union {F(psi)} is consistent (semantically: psi false now, psi true at all future times). Thus M is maximal in TCS but not maximal consistent.
errors.recommendation: The approach needs fundamental revision. Options: (1) Add a different hypothesis to maximal_tcs_is_mcs that rules out the counterexample, (2) Use a different construction that ensures both saturation and maximal consistency simultaneously, (3) Weaken the main theorem temporalLindenbaumMCS to not claim MCS, only temporal saturation.

artifacts.summary: Documents mathematical impossibility discovered during implementation attempt, including detailed counterexample and recommendations
